item.title: Report E-2024110055
item.description:
Report E-2024110055

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-07T12:22:36+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-28
  • City: LAREDO
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On October 28, 2024, four (4) 1-gallon jugs of paint were crushed in transit and released approximately four (4) gallons of paint to the trailer interior and contents of the trailer. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from E3 Environmental (E3) to remediate the impacted site. The crew utilized hand tools and absorbents to remediate the site. The damaged pails and all impacted materials were containerized in two (2) 55-gallon drums for disposal.

item.description:

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Customer had Google Pixel 4 cell phone plugged into powerport at seat when it began to swell. Customer alerted Flight Att6ndant who had customer bring phone back to Aft Galley while instructing another Flight Attendant to obtain the fire containment bag. Flight Attendants added water to fire containment bag and placed cell phone into bag. Phone was swelling and exhibiting some sparking.

item.title: Report E-2024110000
item.description:
Report E-2024110000

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-04T12:23:29+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-31
  • City: DALLAS
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal LDA experienced a UN2051 Nalco 1606A release from (3) 275-gallon poly totes. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct onsite cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 8 ounces of product released from the caps of all three totes. The caps on the totes were loose, resulting in material sloshing out in transit. The material impacted the tops of the totes and a 3” x 3” area of plywood in the trailer. The caps were tightened, and a slosh test was conducted on the totes to ensure there would not be further release. The impacted plywood, pads, and PPE were then containerized into a 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report I-2024090058
item.description:
Report I-2024090058

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-04T12:23:29+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-24
  • City: HOUSTON
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: PORT TERMINAL RAILROAD ASSOCIATION (INC)
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At approximately 9:34 AM on 09/24/24, notification was received that the tank car was leaking product (Diesel Fuel) from the top and down the side. The car was located in our American Yard and our contractor, Haz-Mat Special Services, was contacted for repair and remediation. HMSS identified the issue as three of the six manway bolts were less than tool-tight. HMSS was able to tighten the bolts and resolved the leak.

item.title: Report E-2024100736
item.description:
Report E-2024100736

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-04T12:23:29+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-21
  • City: DONNA
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: LOVE'S TRAVEL STOPS & COUNTRY STORES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 45500
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: It was reported that 495-gallons of gasoline was released impacting a impervious surface of approximately 150’-by-150’, and nearby storm drains that outfall to the onsite retention pond. All the manways and retention pond were checked to verify no fuel had left the property. E3OMI pumped all of the liquid from the storm drains and basin. 21,840-gallons of gasoline impacted water was recovered and processed for recycling.

item.title: Report I-2024100082
item.description:
Report I-2024100082

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-01T09:15:08+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-19
  • City: Brownsville
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: BROWNSVILLE & RIO GRANDE INTERNATIONAL RAILWAY, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On September 19th, 2024@ 1809 BRG Railway was switching railcars out of our clasification yard, when BRG conductor noticed a sheen of oil on the side of tank car TILX 282280, BRG conductor brought movement to a stop and notified BRG Mangement. Railcar was pulled from the industry on 09/17/24 and tank car was staged on BRG tracks on 09/18/24 waiting on documentation. It was concluded that the terminal operator did no properly secure and tighten the top dome hatch correctly, when we pulled it from the industry.
